Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether procedural fairness was breached by not considering applicant's response letter
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly assessed; focus on procedural compliance
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Context, statutory scheme, and individual impact for procedural fairness
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Applicant's burden to ensure receipt of response
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to confirm delivery of response letter
Crimes.Review_Outcome: No breach of procedural fairness found
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Alleged response letter not received or considered
Crimes.Application_Factor: Use of modern communication methods with tracking capability
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Consideration of applicant's response prior to final decision
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s.40(1)(a) – Misrepresentation leading to inadmissibility
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Burden of proof on applicant to demonstrate submission and receipt
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No breach found due to applicant’s responsibility to ensure delivery
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Alleged false information in employment details
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Not directly challenged; procedural issue emphasized
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim that response letter was sent and should have been considered
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to receive applicant's response before decision

Crimes.Crime_Name: Withholding material facts under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether procedural fairness was breached by refusing application without considering response letter
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly assessed; focus on procedural compliance
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Alleged withholding of material facts regarding employment experience
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Context, statutory scheme, and individual impact for procedural fairness
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Applicant's burden to ensure receipt of response
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to confirm delivery of response letter
Crimes.Review_Outcome: No breach of procedural fairness found
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Alleged response letter not received or considered
Crimes.Application_Factor: Use of modern communication methods with tracking capability
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Consideration of applicant's response prior to final decision
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s.40(1)(a) – Withholding material facts leading to inadmissibility
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Burden of proof on applicant to demonstrate submission and receipt
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No breach found due to applicant’s responsibility to ensure delivery
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Alleged omission of material employment information
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Not directly challenged; procedural issue emphasized
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim that response letter was sent and should have been considered
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to receive applicant's response before decision
Crimes.Omission_Type: Withholding material facts about employment history
